title: So how do I learn this whole encoding thing?
content:
My fonts are getting far enough along that I need to start worrying about getting the naming/encodings right as I add stuff. What’s the best way to learn encoding? I’ve heard good stuff about O’Reilly’s _Fonts and Encoding_ but I also know that it’s riddled with errors—are they serious showstoppers that will have me producing screwed-up fonts?

 [‹ how to select a unicode range using python](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709015257/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45222 "Go to previous forum topic") [Making the letter "O" even in width all the way around. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709015257/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44841 "Go to next forum topic")
author: James Puckett

comments.content: The FLS5 manual has a very good chapter about these issues.

Hi James,

There’s also a bit of terminology over [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709015257/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39726).

Best,
